author: 0x1984
content: If block time can be reduced to 10 seconds from 13 seconds, it's already an impressive 25% improvement of ETH capacity - And can have more ETH burnt. Why not put this as a priority to test out, in parallel with DankShading implementation?

author: jgm
content:
To be entirely fair I do wonder occasionally if the last 4s of the slot could be reduced to 2s.  Although I haven't done a full analysis, the last couple of seconds prior to the next slot do appear to be significantly quieter in terms of CPU usage.

(And yes I know that CPU usage hasn't been the main concern as far as the execution side is concerned, and that it would create a(nother) significant increase in bandwidth, and and and, just a thought that crosses my mind now and again.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> Right, but if we were comfortable with higher throughput, it would make more sense to just increase the gas limit. Reducing to 10s slot would be useful in terms of reducing latency of transactions being included

author: jgm
content: Higher gas limit makes things more bursty, though, compared to a reduced slot time.
